alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 1:35PM CDT until August 10 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS PARISHES... At 135 PM CDT, Street flooding was reported on the West Bank in Harvey and Tchoupitoulas between Octavia and Joseph. Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in southwestern portions of New Orleans. Additional rainfall amounts up to three-quarters inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego and Bridge City. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 231 and 236. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 2. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
